basics.name: Haya Kassem
basics.label: AI Evaluator
basics.summary: Motivated data science enthusiast, committed to bridging the divide between data science and policymaking, unlocking the transformative potential of big data.

education.summary: Recognised for best overall performance on the course. Final portfolio invited to be used in promotional materials by the University of Warwick.
highlights: Developed a comprehensive understanding of data science theories, ethical considerations, and practical applications, including advanced techniques in web scraping and data mining, using R, SQL, and Python with a focus on generative AI.
Gained proficiency in creating impactful visualisations using R and Python, with critical analysis from ethical, aesthetic, and methodological perspectives.
Engaged with the technical intricacies of large-scale technological ecosystems, including distributed data processing and decentralised blockchain systems.

education.summary: Graduated with a focus on Middle Eastern and US politics, Consumer Cultures in Global Capitalism, Principles of the Political Economy, and Terrorism and Counterterrorism.
highlights: Acquired proficiency in Stata, LaTeX, and MathType within Computing and Data Analysis modules, significantly enhancing my analytical skill set.
Advanced my Python skills through independent learning, culminating in an undergraduate dissertation recognised with a bursary award for innovative theoretical and methodological approaches.

education.summary: Developed strong research skills and enhanced my understanding of research methodologies.
highlights: Completed an Inquiry and Research Skills module to build foundational research abilities.

education.grade: AS Levels: Maths (A), Physics (A), History (A), Arabic (A); GCSEs: 8 (A*).
education.summary: Achieved excellent academic results across multiple subjects.
highlights: AS Levels: Maths (A), Physics (A), History (A), Arabic (A).
GCSEs: 8 (A*), including Maths (A*), English as a First Language (A*), and French (A*).

work.name: Outlier
work.summary: Optimised content accuracy checks for AI-generated text across multiple subjects and fields.
highlights: Analysed AI responses for bias, inaccuracies, and potential harm using advanced research and data verification tools.
Developed strategic recommendations to refine AI-generated responses, enhancing clarity, reliability, and user relevance.

work.name: University of Warwick
work.summary: Promoted Warwick's academic and cultural environment to prospective students.
highlights: Boosted engagement in recruitment events through talks and campus tours.
Contributed to student recruitment by sharing insights and experiences about university life.

work.name: Seraph Science
work.summary: Specialised in marketing to help tech firms connect with senior executives.
highlights: Generated new leads and conducted targeted searches using LinkedIn Sales Navigator, contributing to a 12% increase in Pathfinder membership.
Built relationships with C-Suite executives to promote services and enhance community awareness, resulting in a 14% increase in engagement.

work.name: The Central Bank of Egypt
work.summary: Contributed to financial risk assessments and supported policy development.
highlights: Analysed data sets provided by CAPMAS using Microsoft Excel and SQL to assess financial risks.
Synthesised economic research into reports, supporting senior economists in policy discussions.
Adapted quickly to a high-pressure environment, meeting tight deadlines and contributing to key economic talks.

work.name: ATEB Group
work.summary: Provided recruitment and payroll audit support for a logistics, engineering, and trading company.
highlights: Streamlined payroll audits using SAP SuccessFactors, ensuring compliance and accuracy.
Assisted with the recruitment process, including posting job ads, screening applications, scheduling interviews, and drafting offer letters.

work.name: Badie and Partners
work.summary: Conducted legal research and supported corporate law cases, specialising in M&A.
highlights: Performed in-depth research and analysis in both English and Arabic to support eight legal cases.
Managed sensitive client accounts and records while maintaining confidentiality standards.

work.name: SeeThru Magazine
work.summary: Collaborated with writers to develop engaging content for publication.
highlights: Conducted interviews for feature stories to add diverse perspectives to the magazine's narrative.
Enhanced story quality by assisting with research and development.

volunteer.organization: Warwick Centre of Interdisciplinary Methodologies SSLC
volunteer.summary: Led initiatives to foster equity, diversity, and inclusivity (EDI) within interdisciplinary academic programmes.
highlights: Established the department's inaugural EDI subcommittee to decolonise the curriculum and promote inclusivity within the MA in Digital Media and Culture, MSc in Big Data and Digital Futures, and MASc in Data Visualisation programmes.
Organised workshops and sessions to make data science practices more accessible and inclusive, fostering an equitable academic community and enhancing learning environments for diverse students.

volunteer.summary: Supported the society's operations by managing communications and administrative tasks.
highlights: Sent weekly communications and memos to members, ensuring clear and consistent engagement.
Maintained invoices, managed schedules, and provided administrative support to streamline the society's activities.

skills.name: Quantitative Skills
keywords: Strong foundation in mathematical and statistical analysis
Capable of handling complex data with accuracy and efficiency

skills.name: Qualitative Skills
keywords: Adeptness in developing strategies, utilising creative and critical thinking to solve problems

skills.name: Communication Skills
keywords: Effective in both verbal and written communication
Skilled at presenting complex ideas clearly and engagingly

awards.title: Pearson Edexcel Outstanding Learners Award
awards.summary: Awarded for the highest mark in Africa in IGCSE History.

awards.title: Outstanding Cambridge Learner Award
awards.summary: Awarded for achieving the highest mark in Alexandria in IGCSE English.

awards.title: COBIS Student Achievement Award
awards.summary: Awarded for exceptional academic achievement across all subjects.

awards.title: CIM Bursary Award For Exceptional Students
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding performance during undergraduate studies, supporting the pursuit of MSc studies at Warwick.

awards.title: CIM Award for Excellence
awards.summary: Awarded for the best Overall Performance in MSc Big Data and Digital Futures.
